summary.p: Wolfgang Mösel has sent Bullinger's letter. On June 9th, he is invited to a conversation with Zwick at Mösel's place. Then he will receive a response and news from Mösel. Bullinger is happy to be of service.

div.p: What you have enjoined, illustrious Bullinger, I have carried out most diligently. On the 5th of June, I sent your letters to Wolfgang Mösel, my dearest father, through a soldier, but I did not receive a response. However, on the 9th of this month, Zwick and I are invited to a conversation. On that day, I will receive a response and news from him. For now, I am sending enclosed what news he has given me, through the aforementioned soldier. On the condition that you return it by his hand. Unless it is necessary, I care little. However, I would not want everything to be made public. Besides, you are greater than I can repay with any services. I do what I do out of duty, I acknowledge you as a teacher and patron and I desire to please you as well as all good and pious people. Therefore, hope for all good things from me through the grace of God.
To the most illustrious man, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, archbishop of the Zurich church, his patron.
